intro: Argomuellera integra, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is typically spherical and has a smooth, yellowish skin. The fruit contains a single large seed surrounded by a sweet, edible pulp. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible fruit in its native habitat.
